summary: This is an email exchange from November 29, 2018, discussing a Miami Herald article about Jeffrey Epstein's 2011 plea deal. An Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York asks a colleague for insight, noting the article suggests Epstein cooperated in a financial fraud case and received non-prosecution. The recipient responds they had not heard of the case but looked it up and found it was a pending inactive case from Miami with old newspaper articles about dissatisfaction with Epstein's deal.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Human Trafficking Co-Coordinator
persons.context: The sender of the initial email asking a colleague for insight about a Miami Herald article on Jeffrey Epstein's 2011 plea deal, suggesting Epstein cooperated in a financial fraud case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the Miami Herald article and the 2011 plea deal discussed in the email exchange. The article notes he cooperated in a financial fraud case and received non-prosecution.

events.title: Epstein's Plea Deal
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein received a plea deal in a case out of Miami. According to the email discussion of a Miami Herald article, he cooperated in a financial fraud case and was non-prosecuted.

events.title: Email Discussion of Epstein Case
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails a colleague about a Miami Herald article on Epstein's 2011 plea deal, seeking insight. The colleague responds they were previously unaware but found it was a pending inactive case with old articles criticizing the deal.

keyFacts: An email from November 29, 2018, shows federal prosecutors discussing a Miami Herald article about Jeffrey Epstein's 2011 plea deal.
The article suggested Epstein cooperated in a financial fraud case and received non-prosecution.
The recipient of the email had not previously heard of the case but found it was a pending inactive case from Miami.
Old newspaper articles in the case file expressed dissatisfaction with the deal Epstein received in 2011.
